column4: hello... i'm trying to get an ati x1600 pro 512mb agp working with linux.. i'm using 2.6.22-14 with the latest fglrx module (8.40.4) loaded.. everything should be working fine looking at the xorg log (no errors and everything appears to load fine) but when X starts the screen goes black... any ideas?
take a look at your Xorg log file in /var/log, you may find some answers there
there isnt anything
are you trying to run the desktop effects?
no i can't run them with vesa
i've also tried using the ubuntu fglrx restricted-modules
Let me get this straight. You've installed the fglrx modules but you are trying to run X with the vesa driver?
no i'm trying to run x with the fglrx driver
Ok, so are you wanting to have the fglrx driver running with the desktop effects?
i don't really care about desktop effects to be honest
My advise to you is to install the ATI graphics drivers manually (NOT from apt or synaptic) from the ATI website.
i have
Ok, please walk me through the process you went through to install the driver?
what was the make and model of the card?
ok, gimme a sec to look something up
ok, does the file /usr/shar/fglrx exist?
the last line in the xorg log is : (II) fglrx(0): [DRI] installation complete
does your xorg.conf file load the agpgart module?
the agpgart module is loaded by the kernel
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?p=3554646
(WW) fglrx: No matching Device section for instance (BusID PCI:1:0:1) found
X doesn't see your card
try:     sudo dpkg-reconfigure -phigh xserver-xorg
set the correct busid in the xorg config brb
